bcbioSingleCell
  • Reference
  • News

Plot Cell-Type Gene Markers

Plot gene expression per cell in multiple formats:

  1. t-SNE plot

  2. Violin plot

  3. Ridgeline plot

  4. Dot plot

plotMarkers(object, ...)

# S4 method for seurat
plotMarkers(object, genes, format = "symbol",
  tsneColor = viridis::scale_color_viridis(),
  violinFill = viridis::scale_fill_viridis(discrete = TRUE),
  dotColor = ggplot2::scale_color_gradient(low = "lightgray", high =
  "purple"), dark = TRUE, pointsAsNumbers = FALSE, headerLevel = 2,
  title = NULL)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments (for the S4 generic definition).
genes

Genes (by symbol name) of which to get expression data.
format

Gene identifier format. Defaults to symbol but ensgene is also supported, as long as Ensembl gene to symbol identifier mappings are defined.
tsneColor

Color palette to use for tSNE plot.
violinFill

Color palette to use for violin plot.
dotColor

Color palette to use for dot plot.
dark

Plot the TSNE against a dark background.
pointsAsNumbers

Plot the points as numbers (TRUE) or dots (FALSE).
headerLevel

Include a Markdown header for each gene.
title

Plot title.

Value

No value, only graphical output.

See also

Other Clustering Utilities: knownMarkersDetected, plotKnownMarkersDetected, plotPCElbow, plotTopMarkers, topBarcodes, topMarkers

Examples

load(system.file(
    file.path("extdata", "seurat.rda"),
    package = "bcbioSingleCell"))
load(system.file(
    file.path("extdata", "topMarkers.rda"),
    package = "bcbioSingleCell"))

symbol <- topMarkers$symbol[[1]]
print(symbol)
#> [1] "ACTC1"
ensgene <- topMarkers$ensgene[[1]]
print(ensgene)
#> [1] "ENSG00000159251"

plotMarkers(seurat, genes = symbol, format = "symbol")
#> 
#> 
#> ## ACTC1
#> 
plotMarkers(seurat, genes = ensgene, format = "ensgene")
#> 
#> 
#> ## ACTC1
#>
